Detailed Description

Abstract interface for the nearest neighbor search algorithm for 3D points.

The interface INearestPoint3DNeighbor is specific to the 3D perception and modeling domain, as it uses Cartesian points.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void brics_3d::INearestPoint3DNeighbor::findNearestNeighbors ( Point3D *  query,
std::vector< int > *  resultIndices,
unsigned int  k = 1 
) [pure virtual]

Find the nearest neighbor point of the query with respect to the data point cloud.

Parameters:
[in]queryPoint that will be queried to the data.
[out]resultIndicesReturns the indices of the $k$ nearest neighbors with respect to the data point cloud. If the nearest neighbor exceeds the maximum distance the returned vector will be empty.
[in]kSets how many nearest neighbors will be searched.

NOTE: setData() must be invoked before.

Implemented in brics_3d::NearestNeighborANN, brics_3d::NearestNeighborFLANN, and brics_3d::NearestNeighborSTANN.

Referenced by brics_3d::NormalEstimation::computeFeature(), and brics_3d::PointCorrespondenceGenericNN::createNearestNeighborCorrespondence().

Parameters:
